content.raw:
I was testing our camera under python 3 today and noticed a bug:

`zprocess.zmq_get_string(self.port, self.host, timeout = 10)`

will raise the following exception:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
      File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/envs/snowflakes/lib/python3.6/site-packages/zprocess/clientserver.py", line 257, in __call__
        data = _typecheck_or_convert_data(data, self.dtype)
      File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/envs/snowflakes/lib/python3.6/site-packages/zprocess/clientserver.py", line 68, in _typecheck_or_convert_data
        raise TypeError(msg)
    TypeError: string sockets can only send strings, not <class 'NoneType'>.

Should I just use a zmq\_get\_raw or will you fix this in zprocess

I was testing our camera under python 3 today and noticed a bug:

zprocess.zmq_get_string(self.port, self.host, timeout = 10)

will raise the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/envs/snowflakes/lib/python3.6/site-packages/zprocess/clientserver.py", line 257, in __call__
    data = _typecheck_or_convert_data(data, self.dtype)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/envs/snowflakes/lib/python3.6/site-packages/zprocess/clientserver.py", line 68, in _typecheck_or_convert_data
    raise TypeError(msg)
TypeError: string sockets can only send strings, not <class 'NoneType'>.

Should I just use a zmq_get_raw or will you fix this in zprocess
